FuncDef:
The ignore-receive-lsa advertise-router command configures the device to discard LSAs of a specified type.
The undo ignore-receive-lsa advertise-router command cancels the configuration of discarding LSAs of a specified type. The ignore-receive-lsa advertise-router command configures the device to discard LSAs of a specified type. The undo ignore-receive-lsa advertise-router command cancels the configuration of discarding LSAs of a specified type. By default, the device is not configured to discard LSAs of a specified type.
CLIs: undo ignore-receive-lsa advertise-router <adv-rtr-id> [ lsa-type <type-value> [ area { <area-id> | <area-idipv4> } ] | link-state-id <ls-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the router ID of the LSA advertising device.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

LSA type.
The value is in hexadecimal notation. The value ranges from 0 to ffff.

Specifies the area ID in decimal format.
The value is a decimal integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies an area ID in IP address format.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the LSID of an LSA.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: Warning: The operation will cause ospf lsdb not correct and can not recover ospf lsdb by undo command,need reset all neighbors to recover lsdb. Continue? [Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo: When abnormal LSAs cause devices on the entire network to repeatedly restart and the LSA that causes protocol restarts is located, you can use this command as a last resort to prevent the devices from constantly restarting. However, incorrect configurations may cause loops.
